title: Low-Carb Teriyaki Chicken & Cauli Rice
description: Juicy pan-seared chicken glazed in a tangy-sweet low-carb teriyaki sauce served over fragrant cauliflower rice. Bright ginger, garlic, and toasted sesame lift the dish while keeping net carbs minimal for a satisfying weeknight dinner.

ingredients.notes: pat dry and cut into bite-sized pieces

ingredients.display_name: cauliflower rice (fresh or frozen, thawed & drained)
ingredients.notes: grated or food-processed into rice-sized pieces
use tamari for less sweet option (not paleo)

ingredients.display_name: brown erythritol or other low-carb sweetener
avocado oil (or neutral oil) for cooking
ingredients.notes: divided between chicken and cauli rice

ingredients.display_name: almond flour (for light coating, optional for crispier chicken)
ingredients.notes: helps browning; skip for strict paleo/whole30
optional step to help almond flour adhere

steps.text: Prepare the sauce: whisk coconut aminos, water, rice vinegar, low-carb sweetener, grated ginger, minced garlic, and toasted sesame oil in a small bowl until smooth; set aside.
Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. If using, lightly beat the egg and toss chicken in egg then coat with almond flour for a light crust; shake off excess.

Heat half the avocado oil in a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add chicken pieces in a single layer without crowding and sear until golden brown on one side, 3-4 minutes.
Flip the chicken pieces and continue to cook until cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F) and crusted, about 3-4 minutes more depending on size. Transfer chicken to a plate and keep warm.

Wipe the skillet clean if necessary, then add remaining oil and reduce heat to medium. Add cauliflower rice and stir-fry, tossing frequently, until tender but not mushy, about 4-5 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.

Return the cooked chicken to the skillet with the cauliflower rice. Pour the prepared sauce over the chicken and cauli rice, stirring gently to coat. Bring to a simmer and cook until sauce reduces slightly and glazes the chicken, about 2-3 minutes.

Taste and adjust seasoning (more sweetener or vinegar if needed). Sprinkle with sliced green onions, toasted sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes if using. Remove from heat and let rest 1 minute before serving.
Portion onto plates and serve hot. Optionally garnish with extra sesame oil drizzle or a lime wedge for brightness.
